publicationStmt.p: Unpublished edition of the music notation of the Seikilos epitaph, from Copenhagen 14897. One note can be of the class `gvn` (Greek Vocal Notation), `gin` (Greek Instrumental Notation), or `gcn` (Greek Common Notation, i.e., the leimma). The description is extended by five arguments. The first is a label for pitch (1-24). The second is the accidental (1-3, for natural, first sharp, and second sharp). The third is the rhythmic value (1-5, for one, two, three, etc. times the duration of a metrically "short" syllable). The fourth is arsis (1 if a stigme is present, 0 if a stigme is not present). The fifth is hyphen (1 for presence of hyphen, 0 for absence of hyphen). Syllables are separated by white space; multiple notes on a single syllable are separated by tilde. Directly adjacent notes with hyphen or rhythmic notation are united under only one instance of that notation type (i.e. a single diseme covering multiple notes); the rhythmic value given by this notation applies to the group of notes as a whole.

sourceDesc.p: Edited directly from photography of the stele
